tool.name: GDAL Merge

param.name: of
param.label: Output format
param.help: Select the output format. The default is GeoTIFF (GTiff). Use the short format name. http://www.gdal.org/formats_list.html

param.name: co
param.label: -co Creation Option
param.help: Creation option for output file. Multiple options can be specified. See format specific documentation for legal creation options for each format.

param.name: ot
param.label: -ot Output type
param.help: Force the output image bands to have a specific type. Use type names (i.e. Byte, Int16,...).

param.name: pixelsize
param.help: Pixel size to be used for the output file. If not specified the resolution of the first input file will be used.

param.name: tap
param.help: (target aligned pixels) align the coordinates of the extent of the output file to the values of the -tr, such that the aligned extent includes the minimum extent.

param.name: ul_lr
param.label: -ul_lr Output file extents
param.help: The extents of the output file. If not specified the aggregate extents of all input files will be used.

param.name: v
param.label: Verbose
param.help: Generate verbose output of mosaicing operations as they are done.

param.name: separate
param.label: Separate band
param.help: Place each input file into a separate band.

param.name: pct
param.label: -pcr Pseudo-color table
param.help: Grab a pseudo-color table from the first input image, and use it for the output. Merging pseudo-colored images this way assumes that all input files use the same color table.

param.name: n
param.label: -n Ignore pixels
param.help: Ignore pixels from files being merged in with this pixel value.

param.name: a_nodata
param.label: -a_nodata
param.help: Assign a specified nodata value to output bands.

param.name: init
param.label: -init
param.help: Pre-initialize the output image bands with these values. However, it is not marked as the nodata value in the output file. If only one value is given, the same value is used in all the bands.

tool.help:
Mosaics a set of images.
http://www.gdal.org
http://www.gdal.org/gdal_merge.html
Raster Processing Tutorial : https://trac.osgeo.org/gdal/wiki/UserDocs/RasterProcTutorial
